elements.title: Gasparilla Pirate Festival (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that since 1904 the Gasparilla Pirate Festival (float pictured) in Tampa, Florida, has featured a pirate-themed parade?

elements.title: to be investigated (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that S. Iswaran was the first Singaporean cabinet minister to be investigated by the country's Corrupt Practices Investigation Bureau since 1986?

elements.title: disappearance of Cecilia Strzyzowski (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2023 Argentine provincial elections were overshadowed by the disappearance of Cecilia Strzyzowski?

elements.title: Steven A. Shaw (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Steven A. Shaw, one of the first food bloggers, decided to pursue the career that he loved after the early death of his father?

elements.title: Catodontherium (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that due to a misunderstanding, Catodontherium was moved from its original genus name?

elements.title: James Townsend (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after becoming "convinced of the evils of slavery", James Townsend left Kentucky for Indiana?

elements.title: Mullae Park (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a bust of South Korean president Park Chung Hee in Mullae Park had a Japanese Rising Sun Flag tied to it and was dragged through the streets?

elements.title: John Williams Reynolds (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a well-publicized conflict with a superior officer led British cavalry officer John Williams Reynolds to take a break from his military career, study chemistry and discover propylene?
